data.text: Mr. Marvin Elbert "Manboy" Marsh, age 83, of Madison, Indiana, entered this life on June 18, 1928 in Jefferson County near Brooksburg, Indiana. He was the loving son of the late, Gabe & Mildred Reed Marsh. He was raised on Splinter's Ridge and attended school there. Marvin was inducted into the United States Army on February 28, 1951 in Indianapolis, Indiana. He rose to the rank of sergeant serving A Company 13th Engineers C Battalion during the Korean War. He was honorably discharged on April 10, 1953 at Camp Atterbury receiving the Korean Service Medal with Three Bronze Stars and the United Nations Service Medal. Marvin was united in marriage on May 16, 1953 in Columbus, Indiana at the parsonage of Rev. O.T. Smith to Mary Goldie Wilson. This happy union was blessed with a daughter and a son. Marvin & Mary celebrated 50 years of marriage together until her death on August 5, 2003. He and Mary resided in Columbus, Indiana from 1975-1996 and Marvin worked for 47 years with Arvin Industries. While at Arvin's, Marvin held every position with the company retiring as janitor. He moved back to his farm he owned near Moorefield in 1996 and enjoyed raising tobacco, cattle and gardening. He loved working with horses and caring for his animals. Marvin enjoyed attending Long Run Baptist Church and Mount Sterling Baptist Church in Switzerland County. After the death of Mary, Marvin enjoyed spending time with Audrey R. Jester Harmon and they were later united in marriage. Marvin enjoyed family get together with Audrey's family and friends. He was a life member of the Vevay American Legion Post 185 and Vevay VFW Post 5396. Marvin was very patriotic and a man that was strong in his convictions. Marvin died Wednesday, December 7, 2011 at 5:08pm at Hosparus Inpatient Unit in Louisville, Kentucky. Marvin will be lovingly remembered by his wife: Audrey Jester Harmon Marsh of Madison, Indiana; his son: Rick Marsh & his wife, Gloria of Commiskey, Indiana; his daughter: Marjorie Jean Henderson & her husband, Ronnie of Midland, Texas; his niece he helped to raise: Adrianna Jane Charlton & her husband, Lenny of Vevay, Indiana; his grandson: Justin Marsh & his wife, Amber of Blocher, Indiana; his great granddaughter: McKenzie Marsh; 4 step children: Sharon Roark Wilson & her husband, Dave of Madison, Indiana, Judy Bailey & her husband, Jack of Vevay, Indiana, Diane Brown & her husband, Denny of Vevay, Indiana, Charles Harmon & his companion, Judy of Madison, Indiana; his brother: Larry Marsh & his wife, Leora of North Vernon, Indiana; his step grandchildren: Dustin, Angie, Michelle, Michael, Shawn, Casie, Amanda, Kara & Krystal; his step great grandchildren: Jalen, Devin, Trenton, Addison, Paytton, Carson, Brady, Nick, Kenny, Jaxen, Maysen & Anelisa; numerous nieces, nephews & other relatives. He was preceded in death by his parents, Gabe Marsh died, Dec. 29, 1971 and Mildred Reed Marsh died, August 9, 1963; his late wife, Mary Goldie Wilson Marsh died, August 5, 2003; his sisters, Anna Mable Furnish Combs died, May 17, 2006, Helen Shepherd, Carolyn Amburgey, Mildred Scudder Blair died, March 18, 1991; Jeanne DeMumbrun died, August 27, 2004; Ernestine O'Neal died, April 8, 2009; Christine Padfield died, March 1, 2007; his brothers, Melvin Marsh died, April 2, 1989; Leland Marsh; Kenneth Harold "Haystack" Marsh died, May 2, 2004; & Ronald Marsh.
